table_description: Access Groups allows to define a set of users to which an application policy can be applied.

columns.name: name
columns.description: Friendly name of the access group.

columns.name: account_id
columns.description: ID of the account, access group belongs.

columns.name: account_name
columns.description: Name of the account, access group belongs.

columns.name: created_at
columns.description: Timestamp when access group was created.

columns.name: updated_at
columns.description: TImestamp when access group was last modified.

columns.name: exclude
columns.description: The exclude policy works like a NOT logical operator. The user must not satisfy all of the rules in exclude.

columns.name: include
columns.description: The include policy works like an OR logical operator. The user must satisfy one of the rules in includes.

columns.name: require
columns.description: The require policy works like a AND logical operator. The user must satisfy all of the rules in require.
